title: Security Schema
description: A security represents a tradable financial instrument held or financed by an institution for investment or collateral.

id.description: The unique identifier for the security within the financial institution.

date.description: The observation or effective date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

acc_fv_change_before_taxes.description: Accumulated change in fair value before taxes.

acc_fv_change_credit_risk.description: Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk.

accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest since the last payment date and due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as an integer number of cents/pence.

asset_liability.description: Is the security (valued at either amortised cost or fair value) an asset or a liability on the firm's balance sheet.

capital_tier.description: The capital tiers based on own funds requirements.

cb_haircut.description: The haircut as determined by the firm's central bank

cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

balance.description: Outstanding amount including accrued interest. Monetary integer number of cents/pence.

base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the rate on the balance at the given date as agreed in the terms of the financial product.

break_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be broken (by either party). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

call_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be called (by the customer). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

country_code.description: Two-letter country code for security location/jurisdiction. In accordance with ISO 3166-1.

cqs_standardised.description: The credit quality step for standardised approach.

cqs_irb.description: The credit quality step for internal ratings based approach.

csa_id.description: The unique identifier of the credit support annex this security falls under. Typically where used as derivatives collateral.

currency_code.description: Actual currency of the security in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer for this product.

deal_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the deal for this product that links it to other products of the same or different type.

encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the security that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities such as within a repo pool. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

guarantor_id.description: The unique identifier for the guarantor within the financial institution.

guarantee_start_date.description: The first day the security became guaranteed by the guarantor. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601

hqla_class.description: What is the HQLA classification of this security?

impairment_amount.description: The impairment amount for a security is the allowance set aside by the firm for losses.

impairment_status.description: The recognition stage for the impairment/expected credit loss of the product.

insolvency_rank.description: The insolvency ranking as per the national legal fraamework of the reporting institution.

isin_code.description: The unique International Securities Identification Number for the security according to ISO 6166.

issuer_id.description: The unique identifier for the issuer within the financial institution.

last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date.

ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

mna_id.description: The unique identifier of the Master Netting Agreement this security falls under. Typically where used as derivatives collateral.

movement.description: The movement parameter describes how the security arrived to the firm.

mtm_clean.description: The mark-to-market value of the security excluding interest. Monetary number of cents/pence.

mtm_dirty.description: The mark-to-market value of the security including interest. Monetary number of cents/pence.

next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

notional_amount.description: The notional value is the total amount of a security's underlying asset at its spot price. Monetary number of cents.

on_balance_sheet.description: Is the security reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

purpose.description: The purpose for which the security is being held.

rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the security notional in percentage terms. Note that this therefore includes the base_rate (ie. not the spread).

rehypothecation.description: Can the security be rehypothecated by the borrower?

reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the security resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

seniority.description: The seniority of the security in the event of sale or bankruptcy of the issuer.

sft_type.description: The sft_type parameter defines the transaction mechanism conducted for the SFT for this security product.

source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

start_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product commences. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

status.description: Describes if capital has been paid up or has been called up but not paid for.

type.description: This is the type of the security with regards to common regulatory classifications.

trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

transferable.description: Can the security be transferred between parties or negotiated on the capital market?

value_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

next_repricing_date.description: The date on which the interest rate of the security will be re-calculated. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.
